column1: Energy and Power Systems Management MSc
column3: School of Energy and Electronic Engineering
column5: OverviewJoin the next generation of specialists who can deliver better energy management in the energy industry, and help reduce our impact on the environment.On this unique Master's in Energy and Power Systems Management, you'll build on your existing knowledge with up-to-date skills and advanced concepts in the operation, control, design, regulation and management of the power systems and networks of the future. You'll follow an industry-accredited learning programme shaped by the sector's needs and practices, guided by our industrial advisory board, and you'll design and deliver a research project specific to your interests in the energy sphere.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full-time (September intake), 3 years part-time (September intake), 16 months full-time (January intake)
